free: #e Oh, your family member, what was his name...  They passed you and Awi's house to ask your husband to go to Paran together, but your husband did not go there.
#c 喔.. 就是妳們的家，是誰呢，妳和Awi（Tiwas Pawan傅阿有的丈夫）的家，他們經過那兒，邀妳先生一起（到霧社），但妳先生沒去。
#e He did not go there.
#c 是，（他）沒去。
#e But your mother and some people went there. Not...
#c 而妳媽媽他們卻去了霧社，沒...
#e You said they went where?
#c （去）哪裡？
#e They went to Paran?
#c 他們去霧社？
#e How come you mixed them up?
#c 你怎麼把它們搞混了？
#n pgmax-un (物品混合、混放；事件混淆)
#e When Temu Mona came to see me, they had not yet planned (to kill the Japanese).
#c 當Temu Mona來探望我的時候，那時還沒起義（殺日本人）。
#n m-ita在此情境為「邀請」之意；也可作字面意解，為「探望」之意
#n Menaq ka "About the thing that I have told... 我說的那個事情呢... "
#n Temu Mona: Truwan village's leader. Truwan的頭目.
#e At that time ...  You are right.
#c 那時.. 是的。
#n This part is talking about People who revolved Japanese。這部分提起義的人。
#e It was the next day when Baso passed your house in the early morning.
#c 是...  隔天，隔天的一大清早Baso經過那兒（你家）。
#n It refers to the following morning隔天早上。
#n IU21 mgrebu sounds like mrebu. Mgrebu聽起來mrebu.
#e On the second day, they killed the policemen at Mbehu. My house was here, just across the bridge.
#c 到了第二天...殺了馬赫坡派出所(駐在所)（的日警）。我家在這裡，這兒是橋頭對面的一端。
#n 日文借字：駐在所(cyuzayso) = 派出所(hasuso)
#e Mhebu village was there.
#c 馬赫坡部落在那邊。
#e At that time, Baso passed your house, is that right?
#c Baso（那時）經過你家，是嗎？
#n Baso指Baso Mona。
#e That road (our house is right beside that road), was our road bounded to Baran. He did not enter our house.
#c 那是道路（我家就在路旁），那是我們（前往霧社）的路，沒進去我家。
#n moda「經過」或「進入」之意。
#e He said to me when standing on the road,
#c 是從（站在）路上對我說的。
#n m-lawa (大聲叫)。
#e "Do not go to Paran. Stay here."
#c 他對我說「不要去霧社，留在這裡」。
#n 「霧社」為清朝官方命名；Baran原意為「苦棟樹」。
#e I myself did not want to go there.
#c 我自己是不想去的。
#e Did your mother go there?
#c 是你媽媽她們去了嗎？
#e My mother said she would go there.
#c 我媽媽說她要去。
#n What she meant to say is 'maha ku ka yaku si bubu mu'. 她應該說'maha ku ka yaku si bubu mu'.
#e She carried back one basket of clothes.
#c 她揹回一簍（的衣物）。
#n During the accident, Seediq woman went to look for cloth that Japanese left.事件發生後，女性去找日本人留下的衣服。
#n bruru女用揹簍。
#n Seediq習俗不拿敵人的物品，以免遭到報復。
#e Are they the Japanese's clothes?
#c 是日本人的衣物嗎？
#e Yes, it was the Japanese's clothes.
#c 是日本人的衣物。
#e I do not know where those clothes went.
#c 那些衣物不知到哪裡去了，是否...
#e She brought those clothes. Did she share them with you?
#c 那些衣物被她帶到.. 她有分給妳嗎？
#n asu為「分給」字根; asu亦為「獨木舟」、「豬飼料槽」，現在為「船」意。
#e She brought them to Mhebu Village.
#c 她把衣服帶到馬赫坡部落。
#e No, she didn't.
#c 沒（分給我）。
#n de= deheya
#e (The Japanese aircraft) came to Paran and then returned.
#c 來到霧社上空即折返（指日本偵察機）。
#e Did you all see it?
#c 妳們看到了嗎？
#e We saw it since they flew just above us in the sky.
#c 看到了，因為（偵察機）飛到上面（空中）。
#e Did they come over to Mhebu?
#c 喔來到.. 沒抵達馬赫坡（上空）？
#e No, they didn't. By that time, they had not come to Mhebu.
#c 沒來到（馬赫坡上空），那時還沒來（到馬赫坡上空）。
#e I see. At that moment did you still stay at home?
#c 是。是。那時妳還留在家裡嗎？
#e Yes, I stayed home.
#c 我留在家裡。
#e Did you sleep at home alone that night?
#c 那天晚上妳還是在自己家過夜嗎？
#e Yes, I still slept there.
#c 我還是在那裡睡。
#n hayan  han 「暫且」或「先」，兩者意義可依聲調起伏分別。
#e When it was the following day...  Pawan, when did the aircraft come to Mhebu?
#c 到了第二天.. ，Pawan（蔡茂琳），飛機飛到馬赫坡上空是什麼時候？
#n 詢問的內容到da為止，Pawan用來將焦點轉至蔡女士身上，請她回答。
#e It was exactly the following day.
#c 就是第二天了。
#n kii=kiya
#e They came on the following day.
#c 隔天來了。
#e So we all hung the (Japanese) flags.
#c 所以族人們說大家要懸掛(日本)旗子。
#e No, it wasn't at that time, Pawan.
#c 還不是那個時候哦 Pawan。
#e How come Suku people gathered there so quickly?
#c Suku的族人怎麼可能會那麼快在那兒集結?
#n kwana nak (how come so fast)「怎麼那麼快」。
#n Suku為部落名稱，郭老師翻為「斯固」部落，現已消失。
#e A bomb attack.
#c 炸彈。
#e It seems that the aircraft dropped the bombs.
#c 嗯... 那可能是飛機投下的炸彈。
#e The pans were scatterd all over the place.
#c 鍋子（炊具）到處散落（因炸彈爆炸所致）。
#n supih 煮湯用的平底鍋子，非炒菜用。
#e Is it because you had not ever seen any aircraft, our people just went to see them?
#c 你們是否... 是否由於（族人們）沒見過飛機，所以族人去觀看（飛機）？
#n d<m>eeda從高處眺望，或是仰望。
#n h<m>ili 主焦型，此處h省略。
#e That's right. We extended our heads out to see them.
#c 是的，因而去探頭看看。
#e Did our people wonder what that was in the sky?
#c 族人們以為（飛機）是何物？
#e Those who ate oranges did not escape. They were just eating oranges in the trees, watching the aircraft from there.
#c 在吃橘子的族人們就不躲藏，他們在橘子樹上吃著橘子，在那裡看著（飛機）。
#e They did not run away.
#c 他們沒逃開。
#e At that time, were there only people of Mhebu?
#c 當時僅是馬赫坡部落的族人嗎？
#e All of our people were there.
#c 所有的族人都在。
#e Did you already gather there?
#c 已聚集在一起了嗎？
#e All the people (of the six villages who protested against Japanese) gathered there.
#c 當時起義抗日的一組人馬(六個部落族人)都(在馬赫坡部落)聚集。
#e We made guns and bullets. They are bullets for the guns. The airplane went...
#c 製作槍彈...  那是槍枝要用的子彈... 去... 飛機...
#e When the aircraft approached us,
#c 當飛機飛過來時。
#n gisu (Tgdaya方言) ; wisu (Toda方言)。
#e Perhaps because we had never seen one, we, children or adults, all went to see the aircraft out of curiosity. How could we not get spotted by the Japanese aircrafts?
#c （族人們）可能因為沒看過飛機，即便是大人或小孩（都一樣），都（好奇地）去觀看飛機。那怎麼不被（飛機上的日本飛行員）發現呢?
#n ngal-un sassing (拍照片、影片)。
#e We all stayed under the eaves leaning against the storehouses, and watched these aircrafts.
#c (族人們）大家都擠在穀倉的屋簷下觀看（飛機）扶著穀倉（觀看飛機）。
#n md-doi baga AF.each.other-grip hand 字面意「相互抓手」為「握手」。
#e From that time, we people began to hang oneself
#c 從那時（族人們）即開始上吊自殺。
#n kndalax 從... ...(空間、時間)。
#e From then on, our people began to hang themselves.
#c 從那時（族人們）開始上吊自殺。
#e The self-hanging started from Mhebu.
#c 從馬赫坡開始上吊自殺。
#e You all escaped for lives.
#c 你們逃難。
#e Some hung themselves, while others escaped to Cakus.
#c 什麼... 上吊的上吊，逃到Cakus的就逃到Cakus。
#n Cakus 地區名，原意為「樟樹」。
#e (The Japanese airplanes) came from behind Daya tribe.
#c 從馬赫坡部落後上的Daya部落方來。
#e There was a house on the field.
#c 那裡的耕地有間耕地住屋。
#e That was in Sipan's place.
#c Sipan之地那兒。
#e many people
#c 很多人。
#e It was behind the upper part of the Daya village.
#c 即（馬赫坡）上部落的後方。
#e Didn't you two pass there before?
#c 你們不是有經過那條路？
#n Pawan蔡茂琳曾帶我(Dakis)去指認本族祖居地之各部落。
#e From around Sipan's place to the slope, all the people committed suicide by hanging themselves. The woman named Obing Dakis was really miserable.
#c 從那Sipan之地的部落周邊、斜坡地..  都有人在那兒上吊自殺，那叫Obing Dakis的婦女，真讓人驚嚇。
#n ake bale 「如此地」、「那麼地」。
#e Her child was really pitiful. He was hung in the valley but alive. He was hung from the tree root, and did not fall into valley yet.
#c 他的孩子好可憐，還吊掛在山谷裡而且還活著，吊掛在樹根尚未掉落至（谷底）。
#n pqaya = pqeya
#e Awi Nobing's mother said that Obing Dakis was going to throw the child into the deep valley.
#c Awi Nobing的媽媽說，Obing Dakis將其孩兒拋入那山谷中。
#e The Suku people told me that Obing Dakis and the Suku people ran away together (Awi Nobing's mother is from Suku village).
#c Suku他們是這麼說的，Obing Dakis與Suku部落的族人一起逃難（Awi Nobing的媽媽是Suku部落的人）。
#n tngoo = tngiyo (all) 「全部」。
#e At that time, Mona Rudo was just sitting over there, saying nothing.
#c 當時莫那魯道就坐在那裡，他一句話也沒說。
#e It is because he was the key figure of this event.
#c 因他是（霧社事件的）關鍵性人物。
#n pusu 「樹根」、「起因」。
#e About how many days? After that...
#c 大概幾天? 之後...
#e Did the Japanese police officers also do the teacher's job?
#c (在部落的)日本警察也是（兼任）教師嗎?
#n 當時警察身兼數職，教導日文、給藥等工作。
#e Even the police officers could be our teachers.
#c 連警察都可以當我們的老師。
#n 當時分派到山區的日本警察普遍素質差，所以本句有不屑語氣。
#e There were no (real) teachers at that time.
#c 那時候沒有老師。
#e Our first teacher was Umin Rasang, is that right?
#c 最初的老師是Umin Rasang對嗎？
#e No, it was not him.
#c 不是，不是。
#e It was later when he began to teach us.
#c 之後才是他(Umin Rasang)當老師。
#e When you went to school, did the teacher not teach you with all his effort?
#c 妳剛去（上學校）時（老師）不好好（認真）教嗎？
#n tbleyaq (emphatic 較強調的用法) = bleyaq
#n orthographically, it should be hani su mnusa we/ge, ini tbleyaq. 如書寫 hani su mnusa we/ge, ini tbleyaq較正確.
#e No, he did not teach us with his full effort.
#c 沒好好（認真）教。
#e It did not matter if you did not go to school.
#c 就是不上學也沒關係。
#e That teacher was lazy at teaching.
#c 我們那位老師懶於教學。
#e While he was teaching us, I learned no kana letters at all.
#c 在他教我們的時候我一個片假名都不會。
#e He simply did not teach us.
#c （他）不教。
#e Do you still remember his name? Then, what happened?
#c 妳知道他的名字嗎？接著又如何呢？
#e Then, we had studied for four years, and we were going to graduate.
#c 接著是...四年...我們唸了四年即將畢業。
#n henu (let me see)「我想想」。
#n m-aalax本意為「丟棄」，亦可指 「畢業」、「退伍」、「退休」。
#e By that time I was going to graduate, I had learned no kana letters at all.
#c 到這時候我仍然連一個片假名都不會。
#e Then, Mr. Kazae Ra came to teach us.
#c 接下來由Kazae Ra 先生（來教我們）。
#e He was devoted and taught us very well.
#c 他就非常用心的教而且教的很好。
#e So, was he a qualified teacher?
#c 喔，那麼他是正式的老師了嗎？
#n 此處意指是否為師範體系畢業的老師。
#e Every night he asked us to go to his house, and taught us kana letters there.
#c 每晚都叫我們到他家，教我們片假名。
#e From that time on, I learned katakana and only katakana.
#c 從那時我就會了，僅片假名而已。
#n nanak = nak nak
#e Those who went the teacher's house were Mahung, I, Bakan Walis and Awe Sisuk.
#c 我們去老師家的有Mahung、我、Bakan Walis以及Awe Sisuk。
#e The four of us who went over to his home were girls.
#c 去老師家的我們四位都是女生。
#e He taught us every night. He called us to go there.
#c 每天晚上教我們，叫我們過去。
#e During the daytime, there were many students.
#c 去，（白天時）很多（學生）。
#e During the daytime, did you play?
#c 白天時.. 妳們在玩嗎（不用讀書）？
#e So, the teacher asked you all to go there at night.
#c 哦~到了晚上老師再叫妳們（去上課）。
#e We were like going to a cram school. The teacher taught us at night.
#c 我們就像是去補習，老師晚上教我們。
#e Perhaps, you are all smarter than others, so you all were asked to go there.
#c 喔，也許妳們... 妳們應該屬於較聰慧的，所以晚上又叫妳們（到老師家上課）。
#e No.
#c 沒有。
#e We were asked to go there because the last police officer's teaching did not work.
#c 被叫去... 那(一開始都不教的)警察教的一點效果也沒有。
#n mmelux 'unsophisticated, uneducated, poor.'
#e I knew no kana letters at all.
#c 連一棵片假名（的符號）我都不會。
#n 因為片假名寫在黑板上像一棵樹。
#e Among the four of you, which one did better?
#c 妳們四個當中哪一位的成績比較好？
#e Bakan did better.
#c Bakan 的成績比較好。
#e It was katakana, only one of the writing systems, and only one kind.
#c 僅片假名而已，僅那一種，只有一種。
#e Only this part did I not forget.
#c 僅這（片假名）而已，只有這部分我沒有忘記的。
#e You moved from there (Mhebu) to here (Gluban).
#c 妳從...妳從那裡（馬赫坡部落）直到這裡（清流部落）。
#e There was no other teacher to teach you katakana, right?
#c 就再也沒有其他的老師教妳片假名了嗎？
#e There was no teacher. I only learned that at that time.
#c 沒有了，就僅那時唸（學）的。
#e You have known katakana since then?
#c 妳是從那時就會（片假名）至今嗎？
#e Yes.
#c 嗯。
#e Later, we learned conversational skills and practiced writing.
#c 接著我們學習會話以及練習寫字。
#e Even at that time, I did some writing, but it was not daily.
#c 即使是在那時候，寫字是寫字... 但那是偶而為之。
#e Since I converted to Christianity, we had been like the first grade again.
#c 信仰天主教後我們又像一年級一樣。
#e We read many books, and we wrote every day.
#c 我們所看的書就非常多，而且我們每天寫字。
#e This made me write very fast.
#c 也讓我在書寫上快得多。
#e So, you gradually made progress.
#c 妳因而... 逐漸進步。
#e Wait a second. Yeah, that's right.
#c 嗯，等一下。真的。
#n iya han (wait for a moment) 「等一下」。
#e All the students at school went there.
#c 學校的所有學生都去那裡。
#e He brought all the boys to practice manipulating wooden guns.
#c 帶領所有的男學生去練習操作木製槍枝。
#e He taught them (a kind of) military drills.
#c 教他們（類似）操兵的演練。
#n pcaping may be loanword, but the source is unidentifiable.
#n pcaping 「從事軍事訓練」。
#e At for the military competition, they outstripped the students of public school.
#c （校際）(軍事訓練)競賽時他們贏了公學校（的學生）。
#e Oh, is that the same teacher?
#c 喔，這位老師嗎？
#e Yes, it was that teacher.
#c 是的，就是這位老師。
#e So, he was in charge of students in Mhebu?
#c 他所帶領的是馬赫坡（蕃童教育所）的學生？
#e Yes, he brought students of Mhebu to Paran for the competition. The Paran school was one of the public schools, a large school.
#c 是，他帶領馬赫坡（蕃童教育所）的學生到Baran（霧社）比賽。Baran的學校屬公學校，是大型的學校。
#e However, our small school in the deep mountain defeated them.
#c 我們深山裡的小學校卻贏得勝利。
#e He taught us really well. The students he taught in Mhebu were all boys.
#c 他教的很好。他在馬赫坡教的都是男學生。
#e He let students practice holding wooden guns and instructed them in the drills.
#c 他讓學生練習拿著木槍，帶領學生操練。
#e After the competition had finished, he stayed in the Paran school and taught there. He did not came back to Mhebu. When the battle happended, unfortunately he was killed.
#c 學生的競賽結束後他就被留在霧社公學校任教沒回馬赫坡了，「霧社事件」爆發時不幸罹難。
#n inu = emphatic particle 強調語助詞
#e I see. Was he killed by those who arose against the Japanese?
#c 喔，被起義的族人所殺害嗎？
#e Yes, he was killed.
#c 是，被殺害了。
#e Um, how pitious it was.
#c 嗯，真是遺憾。
#e It was held at night and it was like having extra lessons.
#c 晚上，猶如補習似的。
#n rih = irih
#e How about the daytime?
#c 那麼白天呢？
#e During the daytime, we had classes throughout the day.
#c 白天時就如一般地上整天課。
#e Did you have classes for the whole day?
#c 那是整天上課嗎？
#e Sometimes, we worked in the field, such as planting vegetables and grooming the vegetable gardens.
#c 有時候我們會工作（學習農務），如種菜及整理菜園。
#e Sometimes we learned things, and sometimes we worked.
#c 有時候教我們（上課）有時工作（學習農務）。
#e Oh, he taught you.
#c 喔，教課。
#e It was just like that.
#c 就是那樣。
#e Yeah, did he teach you to sing songs?
#c 是，有教妳們，唱歌嗎？
#n m-uuyas 唱歌；讀書。
#e He taught songs too.
#c 他也有教歌。
#e There were not many songs in the past, not like today.
#c 以前歌謠不多，歌謠很少，不像現在（很多歌曲）。
#e Could you sing kimigayo (the Japanese anthem)?
#c 妳們會唱kimigayo(日本國歌)嗎？
#e I can, I sang it every morning.
#c 會，那（kimigayo）是每天早晨要唱的。
#e That's their anthem.
#c 那是他們（日本）的國歌。
#e They sang it in the morning,
#c 早上他們唱的就是那首（國歌）。
#e That song is like the anthem of Taiwan, R.O.C. now.
#c 就如（你們現在）唱三民主義，是一樣的。
#e Did you have pencils?
#c （妳們）有鉛筆嗎？
#e We did.
#c 有。
#e Did they provide you with pencils?
#c 鉛筆是他們(老師)提供的嗎？
#e Yes, we had pencils and books from them.
#c 是，那些是他們提供的而且也給我們書本。
#n patis (動詞：寫字；名詞：書)。
#e How about the desk? Was it a simple desk?
#c 桌子呢？簡易的桌子？
#e Yes, we had simple desks.
#c 是，有簡易的桌子。
#e The blackboard was like this size. What we wrote with was...
#c 有這樣大小的黑板, 我們書寫的工具是XXX。
#n XXX 可能指「粉筆」。
#e The words on the blackboard were far from clear.
#c 寫在黑板的字完全不清楚。
#e Do you not have the kind of pen now? It is something like a small tree branch?.
#c 現在已沒有那種筆了？（那種筆）像小枝條。
#e It looked like this, and the pencial trace was quite light.
#c 看起來像這個樣子，寫起來它的劃痕（所寫得的字跡）滿淡的。
#n Patis應該說成spatis 「用來寫的話呢」。
#e We called it "sekibang".
#c 我們稱它為sekibang (粉筆)。
#e We used that for writing.
#c 我們就是用它來寫字的。
#e Um.
#c 嗯。
